page.title: 01RAGDALE AREA LEICS
page.content:
This is a rural area of North_East Leicestershire. It has cultivated and uncultivated farmland, woodland, ancient pastureland, streams and a variety of wild life. It is Quorn Hunting country.
There is one small village _ RAGDALE _ Population 115. Ragdale is 11 miles from Leicester; 8 miles from Loughborough and 6 miles from Melton Mowbray.
Items of interest:
Ironstone Church with Norman Font and ancient stone cross in churchyard; 19th Century Chapel at Six Hills; Durham Ox Inn at Six Hills; Ragdale Hall Health Hydro, once a hunting lodge.
